revised_title: On the Electrocapillary Phenomena and Their Relation to Potential Differences between Solutions
tldr: The author investigates the nature of electrocapillary phenomena and their relation to potential differences between solutions, examining the Lippmann-Helmholtz theory and its discrepancies with the Nernst-Planck theory. The study focuses on solutions of potassium chloride and potassium iodide, providing insights into the electrocapillary curves and the surface tension of the solutions.
